Package model.stock

Interface Stock

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimpleStock
    public interface Stock
    Holds the functionality that all stocks should have. A stock is a representation of a company's stock on the stock market. This interface is used to allow for the comparison of different stocks and to allow for the calculation of different metrics for each stock.

    • Method Detail

      • gainLoss

        double gainLoss​(java.time.LocalDate fromDate,
                java.time.LocalDate toDate)
         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Allows for examining the gain or loss between two dates for this stock. The calculation will use the closing value of the fromDate as the value that will be compared to the toDate closing price. Note: This calculation does not take into account any days in-between and including each date in which data does not exist for this stock.
        Parameters:
        fromDate - the lower bound date to calculate the gain/loss, this value will be used as the starting point for the calculation.
        toDate - the upper bound date to calculate the gain/loss, this value will be used as the ending point for the calculation.
        Returns:
        the difference between the startDate (closing price) and the endDate(closing price)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if either of the dates don't exist for this stock.

      • xDayAvg

        double xDayAvg​(java.time.LocalDate startDate,
               int days)
        throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Calculates the x-day moving average. The x-day moving average is the average of the last x days (starting from the given date). Note: this corresponds to the last x days when the stock prices are available. If the given date is valid and the last x days go beyond validate dates for the given stock, will just calculate the average of the available days.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the start date to begin calculating from.
        days - the past x days from the given starting date.
        Returns:
        the moving average of the past x days from the given starting date.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given date does not exist for this stock or, if there are not the last amount of days available for this stock. The error message should contain the average calculated up until the last available day, and how many days it was able to calculate.

      • xDayCrossover

        java.util.Set<java.time.LocalDate> xDayCrossover​(java.time.LocalDate from,
                                                 java.time.LocalDate to,
                                                 int days)
                                          throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the dates that the x-day moving average is lower than the closing price, in between the given start and end dates. (see xDayAvg() for more information on the moving average) Note for implementation: date ranges can be easily checked by using the compareTo method of the LocalDate class.
        Parameters:
        from - the end date to stop checking for crossovers. (must be less than or equal to the start date)
        to - the start date to begin checking for crossovers. (must be greater than or equal to the end date)
        days - the days to calculate the xDayAvg to check against
        Returns:
        unique dates where the x-day moving average crosses the closing price for this stock.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given from and to date are not within the start and end date of this stock.

      • defDayCrossover

        java.util.Set<java.time.LocalDate> defDayCrossover​(java.time.LocalDate from,
                                                   java.time.LocalDate to)
                                            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the dates where the 30-day moving average is lower than the closing price, Between the given dates. (see xDayAvg() for more information on the moving average) Note for implementation: date ranges can be easily checked by using the compareTo method of the LocalDate class.
        Parameters:
        from - the end date to stop checking for crossovers. (must be less than or equal to the start date)
        to - the start date to begin checking for crossovers. (must be greater than or equal to the end date)
        Returns:
        unique dates in which the x-day moving average crosses the closing price .
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given from and to date are not within the start and end date of this stock.

      • getTicker

        java.lang.String getTicker()
        Returns the ticker symbol of this stock. The ticker symbol is the abbreviation of the company name. (e.g. Apple = AAPL, Microsoft = MSFT)
        Returns:
        the ticker symbol of this stock.

      • getPrice

        double getPrice()
        Returns the closing price of this stock on the most recent date available.
        Returns:
        the closing price of this stock on the most recent date available.

      • getPrice

        double getPrice​(java.time.LocalDate date)
         throws java.time.DateTimeException
        Returns the closing price of this stock on the given date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date you want to get the closing price for.
        Returns:
        the closing price of this stock on the given date.
        Throws:
        java.time.DateTimeException - if the given date does not exist for this stock.

      • getRecentDate

        java.time.LocalDate getRecentDate()
        Returns the most recent date that this stock is available. (i.e. the most recent day in this stocks info, if the most recent day seems off. Probably check to make sure that you have updated everything)
        Returns:
        the most recent date this stock is available.

      • getIPODate

        java.time.LocalDate getIPODate()
        Returns the date that this stock was first available.
        Returns:
        the date that this stock was first available.

      • toString

        java.lang.String toString()
        Allows access to a copy of the raw stock information.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        the raw stock information.

      • fetchClosestStockPrice

        double fetchClosestStockPrice​(java.time.LocalDate dateAt)
                       throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Returns the price of this stock, regardless of whether the market is open. If the market is closed will return the closing price for the recent open date.
        Parameters:
        dateAt - the date to get the closest
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • plot

        java.lang.String plot​(java.time.LocalDate date1,
                      java.time.LocalDate date2)
        The plot of the stock from the given first date to the given second last date.
        Parameters:
        date1 - the date to start the plot from.
        date2 - the date to end the plot at.
        Returns:
        the graph of the stock from the first given date to the last given date.
